inkball

Class Ball

  • java.lang.Object
    • inkball.sprite
      • inkball.Ball

  • public class Ball
extends sprite
    The Ball class represents a ball in the game. It extends the sprite class and defines the behavior and properties of a ball, such as its movement, collision detection, and scoring.

      • checkCollision

        public void checkCollision(tile[][] tiles,
                           int row,
                           int col,
                           int boundary,
                           Ball.Direction direction)
        Detects if the ball collides with the wall.
        Parameters:
        tiles - A 2D array representing the tiles in the game.
        row - The row index of the tile being checked.
        col - The column index of the tile being checked.
        boundary - The boundary value that defines the collision area.
        direction - The direction in which the ball is moving.

      • checkCornerCollision

        public void checkCornerCollision(tile[][] tiles,
                                 int row,
                                 int col,
                                 int boundary1,
                                 int boundary2,
                                 Ball.Direction direction)
        Detects if the ball collides with the corner wall.
        Parameters:
        tiles - A 2D array representing the tiles in the game, where each tile may represent a wall or open space.
        row - The row index of the tile being checked for corner collision.
        col - The column index of the tile being checked for corner collision.
        boundary1 - The first boundary value that defines the collision area at the corner.
        boundary2 - The second boundary value that defines the collision area at the corner.
        direction - The direction in which the ball is moving, which may affect the collision detection.

      • collisionWithHole

        public void collisionWithHole(java.util.ArrayList<Hole> holeList,
                              App app)
        Detects if the ball collides with any hole in the hole list.
        Parameters:
        holeList - A list of `Hole` objects representing the holes in the game, where each hole can potentially cause the ball to change state.
        app - The `App` instance representing the current game application, which may be used for handling game logic and state changes.

      • updateGameScore

        public void updateGameScore(Hole hole,
                            App app)
        Updates the game score based on the interaction between the ball and the hole.
        Parameters:
        hole - The `Hole` object representing the hole that the ball has collided with, which may determine the score update.
        app - The `App` instance representing the current game application, used for managing game state and score tracking.

      • calculateNewTrajectory

        public PVector calculateNewTrajectory(PVector n,
                                      PVector v)
        Calculates the new trajectory of the ball after collision with a normal vector.
        Parameters:
        n - The normal vector representing the collision surface.
        v - The current velocity vector of the ball.
        Returns:
        The new velocity vector after the collision.

      • getCloseNormal

                              PVector p2,
                              PVector n1,
                              PVector n2)
        Determines which normal vector is closer to the ball's current position.
        Parameters:
        p1 - The first point of the line segment.
        p2 - The second point of the line segment.
        n1 - The first normal vector.
        n2 - The second normal vector.
        Returns:
        The closer normal vector to the ball's current position.
